title: Genesis Chapter 35 Quiz - Multi-Level
description: An enhanced quiz on Genesis chapter 35 with Easy, Medium, Hard, and Theological levels. Each level has 15 carefully crafted questions. Choose your difficulty and dive in!

easy.title: Genesis Chapter 35 Quiz - Easy Level
easy.description: Perfect for beginners! Test your basic knowledge of Genesis Chapter 35.

questions.question: Where did God command Jacob to go and build an altar according to Genesis 35:1?
questions.correctAnswer: Bethel
questions.explanation: Genesis 35:1 says God told Jacob to go up to Bethel and dwell there and make an altar unto God.

questions.question: What did Jacob tell his household to do before going to Bethel in Genesis 35:2?
questions.correctAnswer: Put away strange gods
questions.explanation: Genesis 35:2 records Jacob instructing his household to put away strange gods, be clean, and change garments.

questions.question: What did Jacob do with the strange gods and earrings in Genesis 35:4?
options: Hid them under the oak by Shechem
questions.correctAnswer: Hid them under the oak by Shechem
questions.explanation: Genesis 35:4 states Jacob hid the strange gods and earrings under the oak by Shechem.

questions.question: True or False: The terror of God prevented the cities around Jacob from pursuing his sons as they journeyed (Genesis 35:5).
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Genesis 35:5 says the terror of God was upon the cities so they did not pursue Jacob's sons.

questions.question: What new name did God give Jacob in Genesis 35:10?
questions.correctAnswer: Israel
questions.explanation: Genesis 35:10 states God said Jacob's name would no longer be Jacob but Israel.

questions.question: According to Genesis 35:11, God said Jacob would become what?
options: A nation and a company of nations
questions.correctAnswer: A nation and a company of nations
questions.explanation: Genesis 35:11 says God promised Jacob he would be fruitful and become a nation and company of nations.

questions.question: What did Jacob do at the place where God talked with him in Genesis 35:14?
options: Set up a pillar and poured a drink offering and oil
questions.correctAnswer: Set up a pillar and poured a drink offering and oil
questions.explanation: Genesis 35:14 describes Jacob setting up a stone pillar and pouring drink offering and oil there.

questions.question: True or False: Rachel died while giving birth as recorded in Genesis 35:18.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Genesis 35:18 says Rachel died during childbirth as her soul was departing.

questions.question: Where was Rachel buried according to Genesis 35:19?
questions.correctAnswer: In the way to Ephrath (Bethlehem)
questions.explanation: Genesis 35:19 states Rachel was buried in the way to Ephrath, which is Bethlehem.

questions.question: What did Jacob set upon Rachel's grave in Genesis 35:20?
questions.correctAnswer: A pillar
questions.explanation: Genesis 35:20 says Jacob set a pillar upon Rachel's grave.

questions.question: Who was buried beneath Bethel under an oak, as mentioned in Genesis 35:8?
questions.correctAnswer: Deborah, Rebekah’s nurse
questions.explanation: Genesis 35:8 states Deborah, Rebekah's nurse, died and was buried beneath Bethel under an oak.

questions.question: True or False: According to Genesis 35:22, Reuben lay with his father's concubine Bilhah.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Genesis 35:22 records that Reuben lay with Bilhah, his father's concubine.

questions.question: Who were the sons of Leah listed in Genesis 35:23?
options: Reuben, Simeon, Levi, Judah, Issachar, Zebulun
questions.correctAnswer: Reuben, Simeon, Levi, Judah, Issachar, Zebulun
questions.explanation: Genesis 35:23 lists the sons of Leah as Reuben, Simeon, Levi, Judah, Issachar, and Zebulun.

questions.question: Complete the verse from Genesis 35:15: 'And Jacob called the name of the place where God spake with him, ______.'
questions.correctAnswer: Bethel
questions.explanation: Genesis 35:15 states Jacob called the place Bethel where God spoke to him.

questions.question: Where did Jacob come unto his father Isaac according to Genesis 35:27?
questions.correctAnswer: Mamre, the city of Arbah (Hebron)
questions.explanation: Genesis 35:27 says Jacob came to Isaac at Mamre, the city of Arbah, which is Hebron.

medium.title: Genesis Chapter 35 Quiz - Medium Level
medium.description: Ready for more? Apply biblical truths from Genesis Chapter 35 to real-life situations.

questions.question: A believer is struggling with temptation to hold onto worldly things. Based on Genesis 35, what biblical truth would you share about obedience and spiritual discipline?
options: Put away strange gods and be clean before God
Ignore God's commands to avoid conflict
Keep all your possessions as a sign of blessing
Depend only on your own strength to overcome
questions.correctAnswer: Put away strange gods and be clean before God
questions.explanation: Genesis 35:2 teaches Jacob to instruct his household to put away strange gods and cleanse themselves, showing the importance of obedience and spiritual discipline in removing sin.

questions.question: How does Genesis 35 teach us about trusting God during times of distress?
options: God answers and supports us in our distress
We must face distress alone without God's help
Distress is a punishment with no relief
Ignore God and rely on human wisdom only
questions.correctAnswer: God answers and supports us in our distress
questions.explanation: Genesis 35:3 shows Jacob acknowledging God's presence and help in his day of distress, teaching us to trust God in difficult times.

questions.question: When facing a major life change, what practical step does Jacob take to honor God according to Genesis 35?
options: Build an altar and call the place where God appeared
Ignore God and rely on his own plans
questions.correctAnswer: Build an altar and call the place where God appeared
questions.explanation: In Genesis 35:7, Jacob builds an altar at Bethel to honor God’s appearance, teaching us to recognize and worship God during major life changes.

questions.question: A believer is feeling uncertain about their identity and purpose. Based on Genesis 35, what encouragement can you share about God’s promises?
options: God changes Jacob's name to Israel and promises fruitfulness
Our identity depends on human approval
Names and promises have no spiritual significance
questions.correctAnswer: God changes Jacob's name to Israel and promises fruitfulness
questions.explanation: Genesis 35:10-11 records God renaming Jacob as Israel and promising descendants and fruitfulness, showing God establishes our identity and purpose.

questions.question: How does Genesis 35 illustrate the importance of faithfulness in family relationships?
options: Jacob’s respect for Rachel even in her death shows faithfulness
questions.correctAnswer: Jacob’s respect for Rachel even in her death shows faithfulness
questions.explanation: Genesis 35:19-20 shows Jacob setting a pillar on Rachel's grave, demonstrating respect and faithfulness in family life.

questions.question: What lesson about humility and contentment can be drawn from Jacob’s journey in Genesis 35?
options: Jacob travels humbly, setting up pillars and worshiping God
Pride comes from ignoring God’s guidance
Success is independent of God’s blessing
questions.correctAnswer: Jacob travels humbly, setting up pillars and worshiping God
questions.explanation: Genesis 35:14-15 show Jacob humbly setting pillars and offering sacrifices, teaching humility and reliance on God’s blessing.

questions.question: How does Genesis 35 teach perseverance through trials?
options: Rachel’s labor and death show enduring hardship with faith
Avoid all trials by living comfortably
Trials are signs of God’s rejection
questions.correctAnswer: Rachel’s labor and death show enduring hardship with faith
questions.explanation: Genesis 35:16-18 recount Rachel’s difficult labor and death, illustrating perseverance in suffering as part of life’s journey.

questions.question: A believer is struggling with forgiveness in their family. What does Genesis 35 teach about reconciliation and family unity?
options: Despite Reuben’s sin, Jacob continues to bless his family
Family sins should cause permanent division
questions.correctAnswer: Despite Reuben’s sin, Jacob continues to bless his family
questions.explanation: Genesis 35:22-23 shows Reuben’s sin but also Jacob’s ongoing relationship with all his sons, teaching continued family unity despite failures.

questions.question: True or False: In Genesis 35, God promises Jacob that kings will come from his descendants.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Genesis 35:11 records God’s promise to Jacob that kings shall come from his loins, confirming this royal blessing.

questions.question: True or False: Jacob ignored God's command to go to Bethel and did not build an altar there.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Genesis 35:1 and 35:7 show God commanding Jacob to go to Bethel and build an altar, which Jacob obeys, demonstrating obedience.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: Jacob hid the strange gods and earrings under the _____ by Shechem.
questions.correctAnswer: oak
questions.explanation: Genesis 35:4 states Jacob hid the strange gods under the oak near Shechem, symbolizing putting away sin.

questions.question: What does Genesis 35 teach about the importance of dedicating physical places to God?
options: Jacob sets up a stone pillar and offers drink and oil offerings at Bethel
Physical places have no spiritual significance
Only spiritual worship matters, not location
Avoid marking places related to God
questions.correctAnswer: Jacob sets up a stone pillar and offers drink and oil offerings at Bethel
questions.explanation: Genesis 35:14-15 describes Jacob setting up a pillar and making offerings at Bethel, illustrating honoring God through dedicated places.

questions.question: How does Genesis 35 encourage believers in their work and stewardship?
options: Jacob’s careful journey and altar building show diligent obedience
Work is unimportant in spiritual life
Disregard God’s commands in daily work
questions.correctAnswer: Jacob’s careful journey and altar building show diligent obedience
questions.explanation: Genesis 35:5-7 shows Jacob’s careful journey and altar construction as acts of faithfulness and stewardship of God’s blessings.

questions.question: What biblical principle about prayer and personal devotion can be learned from Jacob’s experience in Genesis 35?
options: God appears and blesses those who seek Him sincerely
Personal devotion has no effect on God’s promises
questions.correctAnswer: God appears and blesses those who seek Him sincerely
questions.explanation: Genesis 35:9-12 records God appearing to Jacob and blessing him, highlighting the power of sincere devotion and prayer.

questions.question: How does Genesis 35 model integrity and honesty in family leadership?
options: Jacob openly addresses family issues and honors each son
questions.correctAnswer: Jacob openly addresses family issues and honors each son
questions.explanation: Genesis 35:22-26 lists Jacob’s sons and acknowledges their issues, modeling transparent and honest family leadership.

hard.title: Genesis Chapter 35 Quiz - Hard Level
hard.description: Challenge yourself with deep analysis and cross-biblical connections from Genesis Chapter 35.

questions.question: In Genesis 35:10, God renames Jacob to Israel. What is the significance of this name change in the broader biblical narrative?
options: It signifies a new covenant with God, marking the birth of the Israelite nation
It indicates Jacob's failure and need for repentance
It represents the end of God's promises to Abraham's descendants
It is a common cultural practice with no theological importance
questions.correctAnswer: It signifies a new covenant with God, marking the birth of the Israelite nation
questions.explanation: Genesis 35:10 records God's renaming of Jacob as Israel, symbolizing the establishment of God's covenant people, which develops throughout Scripture as the nation of Israel.

questions.question: What does Jacob instruct his household to do before going up to Bethel, as recorded in Genesis 35:2?
options: Put away strange gods, be clean, and change garments
Prepare sacrifices and fast for three days
Build new houses and gather provisions
Send messengers to Esau for peace
questions.correctAnswer: Put away strange gods, be clean, and change garments
questions.explanation: Genesis 35:2 shows Jacob commanding his household to put away foreign gods, cleanse themselves, and change clothes, highlighting a ritual purification before worship at Bethel.

questions.question: What is the significance of the altar Jacob builds at Bethel and names Elbethel in Genesis 35:7?
options: It commemorates God's appearance to Jacob and affirms Bethel as a sacred meeting place
It is a memorial for Esau's forgiveness
It marks the site of a future temple to be built by Solomon
It serves as a boundary marker for Jacob's territory
questions.correctAnswer: It commemorates God's appearance to Jacob and affirms Bethel as a sacred meeting place
questions.explanation: In Genesis 35:7, Jacob builds an altar called Elbethel ('God of Bethel') to memorialize God's previous appearance, establishing Bethel as a holy site in Israel's history.

questions.question: How does the ritual action of pouring a drink offering and oil on the stone pillar in Genesis 35:14 reflect ancient Near Eastern worship practices?
options: It aligns with common votive offerings symbolizing consecration and divine presence
It was unique to Israel and had no parallel in surrounding cultures
It was meant to appease local deities unrelated to Yahweh
It was a secular tradition with no religious significance
questions.correctAnswer: It aligns with common votive offerings symbolizing consecration and divine presence
questions.explanation: Genesis 35:14 describes Jacob pouring drink offerings and oil on a stone pillar, a practice reflective of ancient Near Eastern rituals to consecrate a sacred site and invite divine presence.

questions.question: What is the theological importance of God reaffirming the Abrahamic covenant to Jacob in Genesis 35:11-12?
options: It establishes continuity of God's promises across generations
It marks the end of the covenant and the beginning of a new religion
It is a localized promise only relevant to Jacob's immediate family
It contradicts earlier promises to Abraham and Isaac
questions.correctAnswer: It establishes continuity of God's promises across generations
questions.explanation: Genesis 35:11-12 reiterates God's covenant made to Abraham and Isaac, emphasizing the unbroken divine commitment through Jacob and his descendants, which is foundational to biblical theology.

questions.question: Which event in Genesis 35 foreshadows the establishment of the twelve tribes of Israel?
options: The naming and enumeration of Jacob's twelve sons in verses 22-26
The building of the altar at Bethel
The burial of Deborah under the oak
questions.correctAnswer: The naming and enumeration of Jacob's twelve sons in verses 22-26
questions.explanation: Genesis 35:22-26 lists Jacob's twelve sons, who become the progenitors of the twelve tribes of Israel, a central theme in biblical history and identity.

questions.question: What is the significance of Rachel naming her son "Benoni" but Jacob calling him "Benjamin" in Genesis 35:18?
options: It reflects a tension between sorrow and hope, with 'Benoni' meaning 'son of my sorrow' and 'Benjamin' meaning 'son of the right hand'
It is a simple translation error with no deeper meaning
It shows Rachel's rebellion against Jacob's authority
questions.correctAnswer: It reflects a tension between sorrow and hope, with 'Benoni' meaning 'son of my sorrow' and 'Benjamin' meaning 'son of the right hand'
questions.explanation: Genesis 35:18 reveals Rachel's sorrow in naming her son Benoni, while Jacob renames him Benjamin, signifying strength and blessing, a typology of sorrow redeemed by hope.

questions.question: True or False: According to Genesis 35:22, Reuben, Jacob's firstborn, committed an offense by lying with Bilhah, his father's concubine.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Genesis 35:22 explicitly states that Reuben lay with Bilhah, his father's concubine, an act considered a serious violation in the cultural and familial context of the time.

questions.question: What is the literary function of the narrative about Deborah, Rebekah's nurse, in Genesis 35:8?
options: It serves as a memorial marker and adds historical depth to Bethel
It is a parallel to Rachel's death illustrating maternal loss
It introduces a new covenant ceremony
questions.correctAnswer: It serves as a memorial marker and adds historical depth to Bethel
questions.explanation: Genesis 35:8 records Deborah's burial and names the oak Allonbachuth, enriching Bethel's sacred significance with personal and communal memory, a common biblical literary device.

questions.question: How does the terror of God upon surrounding cities in Genesis 35:5 function within the narrative's historical context?
options: It demonstrates divine protection over Jacob's journey in a hostile environment
It indicates a literal earthquake that destroyed nearby cities
It suggests that Jacob had a large army
It is a metaphor for Jacob's fear
questions.correctAnswer: It demonstrates divine protection over Jacob's journey in a hostile environment
questions.explanation: Genesis 35:5 describes God instilling terror in surrounding cities to protect Jacob's family during their migration, reflecting ancient Near Eastern views of divine intervention in human affairs.

questions.question: Which location is identified as the place where Isaac was buried according to Genesis 35:29?
questions.correctAnswer: Hebron
questions.explanation: Genesis 35:29 states that Isaac was buried in Hebron, a city significant as a patriarchal burial site and a center of Israelite heritage.

questions.question: What does the Hebrew name 'Allonbachuth' given to the oak where Deborah was buried mean, and what is its literary significance?
options: 'Oak of Weeping', symbolizing mourning and remembrance
questions.correctAnswer: 'Oak of Weeping', symbolizing mourning and remembrance
questions.explanation: Genesis 35:8 names the oak 'Allonbachuth', meaning 'oak of weeping', serving as a literary motif for grief and memory in the narrative landscape.

questions.question: How does Jacob's act of hiding the strange gods and earrings under the oak at Shechem in Genesis 35:4 illustrate the cultural context of idolatry?
options: It shows the household's previous involvement with idolatry and the need to remove pagan influences before worshiping Yahweh
It indicates that Jacob supported multiple gods openly
It was a symbolic act with no real cultural relevance
It was a legal requirement imposed by local rulers
questions.correctAnswer: It shows the household's previous involvement with idolatry and the need to remove pagan influences before worshiping Yahweh
questions.explanation: Genesis 35:4 indicates that Jacob's household had objects associated with pagan worship, reflecting common ancient Near Eastern practices and the biblical imperative to worship Yahweh alone.

questions.question: What is the significance of Jacob setting up a pillar and calling the place Bethel in Genesis 35:15 in relation to his earlier experience in Genesis 28?
options: It reaffirms Bethel as a sacred site of divine encounter and covenant
It is the first mention of Bethel in the Bible
It signifies Jacob's rejection of God
It marks the end of Jacob's travels
questions.correctAnswer: It reaffirms Bethel as a sacred site of divine encounter and covenant
questions.explanation: Genesis 35:15 echoes Genesis 28 where Jacob first saw the ladder to heaven at Bethel, emphasizing its ongoing significance as a place of divine revelation and promise.

questions.question: How does the death of Rachel in Genesis 35:19-20 function as a narrative and theological motif?
options: It highlights the cost of God's promises and introduces the tribe of Benjamin
It is an unrelated event with no further impact
It serves to end the matriarchal line
It illustrates divine punishment for disobedience
questions.correctAnswer: It highlights the cost of God's promises and introduces the tribe of Benjamin
questions.explanation: Rachel's death in Genesis 35:19-20 marks the painful cost of childbirth and the continuation of God's covenant through her son Benjamin, foreshadowing Israel's tribal structure.

theological.title: Genesis Chapter 35 Quiz - Theological Level
theological.description: Deep biblical theology from Genesis Chapter 35 that unites all believers. Explore foundational truths about God, creation, and humanity.

questions.question: What command did God give to Jacob regarding Bethel?
options: Arise, go up to Bethel, and dwell there
Build a city and establish a kingdom
Go to Egypt and settle there
Offer a burnt sacrifice on Mount Sinai
questions.correctAnswer: Arise, go up to Bethel, and dwell there
questions.explanation: Genesis 35:1 records God commanding Jacob to arise, go up to Bethel, and dwell there to make an altar. This fits the biblical theme of God calling His people to worship and covenant renewal (Exodus 3:5; Joshua 24:15; Psalm 84:10; Hebrews 11:10).

questions.question: What was Jacob's instruction to his household before going to Bethel?
options: Put away strange gods and change garments
questions.correctAnswer: Put away strange gods and change garments
questions.explanation: In Genesis 35:2, Jacob commands his household to put away strange gods and be clean, symbolizing repentance and holiness. This aligns with God's call for purity (Exodus 20:3-5; Joshua 5:15; 2 Corinthians 6:17; 1 John 5:21).

questions.question: Where did Jacob hide the strange gods and earrings collected from his household?
options: At the entrance of his tent
questions.correctAnswer: Under the oak by Shechem
questions.explanation: Genesis 35:4 reports Jacob hid the strange gods under the oak at Shechem. This act represents renouncing idolatry, consistent with Old Testament emphasis on rejecting false gods (Deuteronomy 12:3; 1 Kings 13:2; Jeremiah 10:14; Acts 17:16).

questions.question: What effect did the terror of God have on the cities around Jacob's journey?
options: They did not pursue the sons of Jacob
questions.correctAnswer: They did not pursue the sons of Jacob
questions.explanation: Genesis 35:5 states the terror of God protected Jacob's group, preventing pursuit. This shows God's providential protection (Exodus 14:13-14; Psalm 34:7; Isaiah 41:10; 2 Thessalonians 3:3).

questions.question: What new name did God give to Jacob?
questions.correctAnswer: Israel
questions.explanation: In Genesis 35:10, God renames Jacob as Israel, signifying his role as the father of God's covenant people. This name change denotes transformation and covenant identity (Genesis 32:28; Romans 9:6-8; Galatians 6:16; Revelation 21:12).

questions.question: What promise did God reaffirm to Israel concerning his descendants and the land?
options: I will give the land to you and your seed
You will be a wandering people without land
Your descendants will serve foreign kings
The land will be cursed for your disobedience
questions.correctAnswer: I will give the land to you and your seed
questions.explanation: Genesis 35:12 renews the Abrahamic covenant that the land given to Abraham and Isaac will be given to Jacob and his descendants. This reflects God's faithfulness to His promises (Genesis 12:7; Exodus 6:8; Joshua 1:3; Hebrews 11:9).

questions.question: What did Jacob do at the place where God spoke to him after the blessing?
options: Set up a stone pillar and poured drink offering and oil
questions.correctAnswer: Set up a stone pillar and poured drink offering and oil
questions.explanation: Genesis 35:14 describes Jacob erecting a pillar and making offerings, a common Old Testament practice to commemorate divine encounters (Exodus 24:4; Joshua 4:20; 1 Kings 18:30; Hebrews 13:15).

questions.question: What significant event occurred when Jacob's family journeyed from Bethel?
options: Rachel died giving birth to Benjamin
questions.correctAnswer: Rachel died giving birth to Benjamin
questions.explanation: Genesis 35:16-19 records Rachel's death in childbirth, marking a tragic and pivotal moment in Israel's family history, foreshadowing themes of suffering and God’s providence (Exodus 1:22; Luke 2:7; John 16:21; Revelation 21:4).

questions.question: What name did Rachel give to her dying son, and what name did Jacob call him?
questions.correctAnswer: Benoni (Rachel), Benjamin (Jacob)
questions.explanation: Genesis 35:18 shows Rachel named her son Benoni (son of my sorrow), but Jacob named him Benjamin (son of the right hand), illustrating hope amidst sorrow (Psalm 56:8; Isaiah 49:15; Matthew 2:20; Romans 8:28).

questions.question: Where was Rachel buried after her death?
questions.correctAnswer: In the way to Ephrath (Bethlehem)
questions.explanation: Genesis 35:19 states Rachel was buried near Bethlehem, linking her to the region associated later with David and the Messiah (Micah 5:2; Luke 2:4-7; Matthew 2:6; John 11:17).

questions.question: Who went and lay with Bilhah, Jacob's concubine, as recorded in this chapter?
questions.correctAnswer: Reuben
questions.explanation: Genesis 35:22 reports Reuben's sin with Bilhah, illustrating human fallenness and brokenness even in God's chosen family (2 Samuel 12:7; Psalm 51:5; Romans 3:23; 1 Corinthians 6:18).

questions.question: How many sons did Jacob have, according to this chapter?
questions.correctAnswer: Twelve
questions.explanation: Genesis 35:22 states that Jacob had twelve sons, who become the patriarchs of the twelve tribes of Israel, foundational for the nation of Israel (Genesis 49:28; Exodus 1:1-5; Revelation 7:5-8; Romans 11:1-2).

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT one of the sons of Leah listed in this chapter?
questions.correctAnswer: Benjamin
questions.explanation: Genesis 35:23 lists Leah’s sons, excluding Benjamin who was Rachel’s son (Genesis 35:24). This distinction underscores tribal lineage and God's sovereign election (Numbers 1:5-15; Deuteronomy 33:7; Luke 3:33; Hebrews 7:14).

questions.question: To whom did Jacob return at the end of this chapter?
questions.correctAnswer: Isaac his father at Mamre
questions.explanation: Genesis 35:27 records Jacob’s return to Isaac at Mamre (Hebron), highlighting themes of family restoration and covenant continuity (Genesis 26:12-33; Hebrews 11:20; Romans 9:7; John 8:39).

questions.question: How old was Isaac when he died according to this chapter?
questions.correctAnswer: 180 years
questions.explanation: Genesis 35:28 states Isaac lived 180 years, indicating a long and blessed life consistent with patriarchal lifespans (Genesis 25:7; Psalm 90:10; Job 42:16; Luke 1:7).

questions.question: Who buried Isaac according to Genesis 35?
questions.correctAnswer: Esau and Jacob
questions.explanation: Genesis 35:29 records that Esau and Jacob buried Isaac together, illustrating reconciliation and fulfillment of family duties (Genesis 50:1-6; Matthew 5:23-24; Romans 12:18; Hebrews 11:21).
